Introduction to Esports
Module 2: Benefits of an Esports Program

Building Community

A recent survey shows that 72% of American teens play video games regularly. Why not capitalize on and engage students in what they are already doing? Esports offers the opportunity to reach students who are often otherwise disengaged from the school community. According to MASSP and MHSEL, 45% of students involved in sports haven't participated in any other school sports or activity. Thousands of high schools across the country are reaching a new student population by offering esports. Players develop a sense of belonging and have opportunities to meet new friends, and foster school pride by playing on a team with fellow classmates.

“Esports: No matter the result, when students compete, school culture wins.”

- Esports is Here to Stay, Maggie Helmer, MASSP

“Esports is knocking down barriers and setting high standards for inclusion.”

Samuel Schachter, Coach of Barrington High School in Rhode Island

Additionally, esports is more inclusive than traditional sports. Athleticism, gender, race, age, and ability level do not factor into who can participate. All students can equally participate and demonstrate their leadership skills and game strategies. Any student who can use a computer, console, or mobile device can play. There’s no limit on how many teams can form at the varsity level, giving all players an opportunity to compete. Esport teams are all-inclusive and co-ed, offering students opportunities to learn, grow, and support each other.

“Esports has given me a chance to come out of my shell and make friends through one of my favorite pastimes. It has brought me confidence in my abilities that I hope will continue to grow.”

Rebecka Brunberg, Westin High School, Connecticut

Additionally, esports allows students to participate in a variety of ways aside from the obvious player role. The following are common positions on esports teams:

  • Team Manager: manages schedule, team roster and communicates team-related information
  • Videographers: captures video content of matches/teams/coaches for promotional products
  • Casters: provides play by play commentary in live streaming
  • Streamers: captures live match content for producing online viewing
  • Social Media Moderator: streaming and Twitch channel moderation
  • Technical Support: ensure IT/gaming equipment is functioning properly
